Non-nutritional anemia:
Non-nutritional anemia can be due to chronic blood loss in conditions such as heavy menstruation and/or 
haemorrhoids. Non-nutritional anemia can also be due to haemoglobinopathies such as sickle cell disease and 
thalassemia. In areas endemic for malaria, fluorosis and haemoglobinopathies, non-nutritional anemia is a 
common finding. 
In the endemic areas, special focus should be given to integrate screening and treatment of anemia, along with
